Package mud

Class Character

  • java.lang.Object
    • mud.GameObject
      • mud.Character
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Mob, Player

    public abstract class Character
extends GameObject
    An abstract class that represents a character in the game's model. As it is abstract, this class cannot be instantiated. Consider using Player or Mob, or create your own subclass.

    • Constructor Summary

      Creates a new Character.

      Creates a new Chracter with the supplied parameters.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Character

        public Character​(java.lang.String name,
                 java.lang.String description,
                 Room location,
                 java.util.List<Item> inventory)
        Creates a new Chracter with the supplied parameters. This is the primary constructor of Character; all other constructors are convenince.

      • Character

        public Character​(java.lang.String name,
                 java.lang.String description,
                 Room location)
        Creates a new Character. Equivalent to passing an empty list to the inventory parameter of the primary constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • getLocation

        public Room getLocation​()
        Gets the Room this Character is in. This method should not be called by classes other than Game. In a formal project, this would be enforced using multiple packages, but for now just avoid using it in places like UserInterface.

      • getItems

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getItems​()
        Gets a description of this Character's inventory.
        Returns:
        A list of Strings representing the names of the Item objects in this Character's inventory.

      • addItem

        public java.lang.String addItem​(Item item)

      • removeItem

        public java.lang.String removeItem​(Item item)

      • move

        public java.lang.String move​(java.lang.String direction)
        Move this character in a direction.
        Parameters:
        direction - A String representing the direction to move the Character in.
        Returns:
        A String representing the result of this method, suitable for display to the end user.
